thread.title: Britain's four mobile networks win new airwaves in auction

title: Britain's four mobile networks win new airwaves in auction
text:
April 5, 2018 / 6:34 AM / Updated 7 minutes ago Britain's four mobile networks win new airwaves in auction Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
LONDON (Reuters) - All four of Britain’s mobile networks won more airwaves for 4G and future 5G services in an auction that raised 1.36 billion pounds, with Telefonica’s O2 securing the most. FILE PHOTO: A woman speaks on her mobile telephone outside an O2 shop in Loughborough, Britain, January 23, 2015. REUTERS/Darren Staples/File Photo 
Britain’s telecoms regulator said Telefonica won two 40 Mhz tranches at a cost of nearly 524 million pounds, while Vodafone won 50 Mhz for 378 million pounds, Hutchison’s 3 won 20 Mhz for 151 million pounds and BT’s EE picked up 40 Mhz for almost 303 million pounds. Reporting by Paul Sandle; editing by Costas Pitas
